turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Hi, I'm looking for some help with my latest bill. I was charged $150, but my plan is only supposed to be $100. This is frustrating, it's happened before.

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Hello! I understand your frustration. I can certainly help with that. Could you please provide me with your account number or the phone number associated with your account so I can pull up your billing information?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Sure, it's 555-123-4567. I just don't get why this keeps happening. I've been a customer for years!

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: Thank you. I'm looking at your account now. I see the charge of $150. It appears you were charged for data overage. Did you perhaps exceed your monthly data limit?

turns.speaker: user
turns.utterance: Data overage? That's weird, I'm usually connected to my home wifi. And even if I did, shouldn't there be some kind of notification? Also, why is the overage charge so high? Is there some way to prevent this in the future?

turns.speaker: agent
turns.utterance: I understand your concern. While our system *should* send a notification, it appears there might have been a delay. As for the charge, data overage is billed at $10 per gigabyte over your limit. To prevent this in the future, I can add a data usage alert to your account that triggers when you reach 75% of your limit, and I can also look into options to increase your data plan if that's something you're interested in. We also have a feature that can automatically pause data when you reach your limit. Would you like me to enable either of those?
